010package imagingbook.pub.color.quantize;
011
012
013import java.util.AbstractSet;
014import java.util.Arrays;
015import java.util.Comparator;
016import java.util.HashSet;
017import java.util.Set;
018
019import ij.IJ;
020import ij.ImagePlus;
021import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
022import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
023import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
024import imagingbook.lib.color.RgbUtils;
025import imagingbook.pub.color.statistics.ColorHistogram;
026
027/**
028 * This is an implementation of Heckbert's median-cut color quantization algorithm 
029 * (Heckbert P., "Color Image Quantization for Frame Buffer Display", ACM Transactions
030 * on Computer Graphics (SIGGRAPH), pp. 297-307, 1982).
031 * Unlike in the original algorithm, no initial uniform (scalar) quantization is used to
032 * for reducing the number of image colors. Instead, all colors contained in the original
033 * image are considered in the quantization process. After the set of representative
034 * colors has been found, each image color is mapped to the closest representative
035 * in RGB color space using the Euclidean distance.
036 * The quantization process has two steps: first a ColorQuantizer object is created from
037 * a given image using one of the constructor methods provided. Then this ColorQuantizer
038 * can be used to quantize the original image or any other image using the same set of 
039 * representative colors (color table).
040 * 
041 * @author WB
042 * @version 2017/01/03
043 * 
044 * TODO: needs revision!
045 */
046public class MedianCutQuantizer implements ColorQuantizer {
047        
048        private final ColorNode[] allColors;    // a vector of color nodes (used by inner classes)
049        private final Set<ColorBox> quantColors;
050//      private final ColorNode root;           TODO: organize color boxes in a tree
051        
052        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
053        
054        public MedianCutQuantizer(ColorProcessor ip, int K) {
055                this((int[]) ip.getPixels(), K);
056        }
057                 
058        public MedianCutQuantizer(int[] pixels, int K) {
059                allColors = getAllColors(pixels);
060                if (allColors.length <= K) {            // not enough colors, nothing to quantize
061                        quantColors = null;
062                        return;
063                }
064                else {
065                        quantColors = findReferenceColors(K);
066                }
067        }
068        
069        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
070        
071//      void listColors(ColorNode[] colors) {
072//              for (ColorNode nd : colors) {
073//                      IJ.log(nd.toString());
074//              }
075//      }
076        
077        private ColorNode[] getAllColors(int[] pixels) {
078                ColorHistogram colorHist = new ColorHistogram(pixels);
079                final int nc = colorHist.getNumberOfColors();
080                ColorNode[] colors = new ColorNode[nc];
081                for (int i = 0; i < nc; i++) {
082                        int rgb = colorHist.getColor(i);
083                        int cnt = colorHist.getCount(i);
084                        colors[i] = new ColorNode(rgb, cnt);
085                }
086                return colors;
087        }
088
089        private Set<ColorBox> findReferenceColors(int K) {
090                final int n = allColors.length;
091
092                ColorBox cb0 = new ColorBox(0, n - 1, 0);
093                AbstractSet<ColorBox> B = new HashSet<ColorBox>();
094                B.add(cb0);
095                
096                int k = 1;                                              // number of quantized color (color boxes)
097                boolean done = false;
098                
099                while (k < K && !done) {
100                        ColorBox cb = findBoxToSplit(B);
101                        if (cb != null) {
102                                ColorBox[] boxes = cb.splitBox();
103                                B.remove(cb);
104                                B.add(boxes[0]);
105                                B.add(boxes[1]);
106                                k = k + 1;
107                        } else {
108                                done = true;
109                        }
110                }
111                return B;
112
113        }
114        
115        private float[][] makeColorMap(Set<ColorBox> quantColors) {
116                int n = quantColors.size();
117                float[][] map = new float[n][];
118                int i = 0;
119                for (ColorBox cb : quantColors) {
120                        map[i] = cb.getAvgColor();
121                        i++;
122                }
123                return map;
124        }
125        
126        private ColorBox findBoxToSplit(Iterable<ColorBox> colorBoxes) {
127                // from the set of splitable color boxes
128                // select the one with the minimum level
129                ColorBox boxToSplit = null;
130                int minLevel = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
131                for (ColorBox cb : colorBoxes) {
132                        if (cb.colorCount() >= 2) {     // box can be split
133                                if (cb.level < minLevel) {
134                                        boxToSplit = cb;
135                                        minLevel = cb.level;
136                                }
137                        }
138                }
139                return boxToSplit;
140        }
141        
142//      private ColorNode[] getAvgColors(Iterable<ColorBox> colorBoxes) {
143//              //int n = colorBoxes.size();
144////            ColorNode[] avgColors = new ColorNode[colorBoxes.size()];
145//              List<ColorNode> avgColors = new ArrayList<>();
146//              int i = 0;
147//              for (ColorBox box : colorBoxes) {
148//                      //avgColors[i] = box.getAvgColor();
149//                      avgColors.add(box.getAvgColor());
150//                      i = i + 1;
151//              }
152////            return avgColors;
153//              return avgColors.toArray(new ColorNode[0]);
154//      }
155        
156        
157        // ------- methods required by abstract super class -----------------------
158        
159        @Override
160        public float[][] getColorMap() {
161                return makeColorMap(quantColors);
162        }
163
164        // -------------- class ColorNode -------------------------------------------
165
166        private class ColorNode {
167                private final int red, grn, blu;
168                private final int cnt;
169                
170                ColorNode (int rgb, int cnt) {
171                        //this.rgb = (rgb & 0xFFFFFF);
172                        int[] c = RgbUtils.intToRgb(rgb);
173                        this.red = c[0];
174                        this.grn = c[1];
175                        this.blu = c[2];
176                        this.cnt = cnt;
177                }
178                
179                ColorNode (int red, int grn, int blu, int cnt) {
180                        //this.rgb = Rgb.rgbToInt(red, grn, blu);
181                        this.red = red;
182                        this.grn = grn;
183                        this.blu = blu;
184                        this.cnt = cnt;
185                }
186                
187                public String toString() {
188                        String s = ColorNode.class.getSimpleName();
189                        s = s + " red=" + red + " green=" + grn + " blue=" + blu + " count=" + cnt;
190                        return s;
191                }
192        }
193        
194        // -------------- non-static inner class ColorBox -----------------------------------
195
196        /**
197         * Represents a 'color box' holding a set of colors (of type {@link ColorNode}),
198         * which is implemented as a contiguous range of elements in array
199         * {@link MedianCutQuantizer#allColors}. Instances of {@link ColorBox} reference
200         * this array directly (this is why this class is non-static).
201         */
202        private class ColorBox { 
203                final int lower;                // lower index into 'imageColors'
204                final int upper;                // upper index into 'imageColors'
205                final int level;                // split level of this color box
206                
207                int count = 0;  // number of pixels represented by this color box
208                float rmin, rmax;       // range of contained colors in red dimension
209                float gmin, gmax;       // range of contained colors in green dimension
210                float bmin, bmax;       // range of contained colors in blue dimension
211                
212                ColorBox(int lower, int upper, int level) {
213                        this.lower = lower;
214                        this.upper = upper;
215                        this.level = level;
216                        this.trim();
217                }
218                
219                /**
220                 * Returns the number of different colors within this color box.
221                 * @return the number of different colors
222                 */
223                int colorCount() {
224                        return upper - lower;
225                }
226                
227                /**
228                 * Recalculates the boundaries and population of this color box.
229                 */
230                private void trim() {
231                        int n = 0;      
232                        rmin = gmin = bmin = MAX_RGB;
233                        rmax = gmax = bmax = 0;
234                        for (int i = lower; i <= upper; i++) {
235                                ColorNode color = allColors[i];
236                                n = n + color.cnt;
237                                rmax = Math.max(color.red, rmax);
238                                rmin = Math.min(color.red, rmin);
239                                gmax = Math.max(color.grn, gmax);
240                                gmin = Math.min(color.grn, gmin);
241                                bmax = Math.max(color.blu, bmax);
242                                bmin = Math.min(color.blu, bmin);
243                        }
244                        count = n;
245                }
246                
247                /**
248                 * Splits this color box at the median point along its 
249                 * longest color dimension. Modifies the original color
250                 * box and creates a new one, which is returned.
251                 * @return A new box.
252                 */
253                ColorBox[] splitBox() { 
254                        if (this.colorCount() < 2)      // this box cannot be split
255                                return null;
256                        else {
257                                int m = this.level;
258                                // find longest dimension of this box:
259                                ColorDimension d = this.getMaxBoxDimension();
260                                // find median along dimension d
261                                int med = this.findMedian(d);
262                                // now split this box at the median return the resulting new box
263                                ColorBox b1 = new ColorBox(lower, med, m + 1);
264                                ColorBox b2 = new ColorBox(med + 1, upper, m + 1);
265                                return new ColorBox[] {b1, b2};
266                        }
267                }
268                
269                /**
270                 * Finds the longest dimension of this color box (RED, GREEN, or BLUE)
271                 * @return The color dimension of the longest box side.
272                 */
273                ColorDimension getMaxBoxDimension() {
274                        final float rLength = rmax - rmin;
275                        final float gLength = gmax - gmin;
276                        final float bLength = bmax - bmin;
277                        if (bLength >= rLength && bLength >= gLength)
278                                return ColorDimension.BLU;
279                        else if (gLength >= rLength && gLength >= bLength)
280                                return ColorDimension.GRN;
281                        else 
282                                return ColorDimension.RED;
283                }
284                                
285                /**
286                 * Finds the position of the median of this color box in RGB space along
287                 * the red, green or blue dimension, respectively.
288                 * @param dim Color dimension.
289                 * @return The median value.
290                 */
291                int findMedian(ColorDimension dim) {
292                        // sort color in this box along dimension dim:
293                        Arrays.sort(allColors, lower, upper + 1, dim.comparator);
294                        // find the median point:
295                        int half = count / 2;
296                        int k, pixCnt;
297                        for (k = lower, pixCnt = 0; k < upper; k++) {
298                                pixCnt = pixCnt + allColors[k].cnt;
299                                if (pixCnt >= half)
300                                        break;
301                        }                       
302                        return k;               // k = index of median
303                }
304                
305                /**
306                 * Calculates the (linear) average of the colors contained in this color box
307                 * and returns the result as a {@link ColorNode} instance.
308                 * The components are not rounded to integers (this is why they are of type float
309                 * in the first place).
310                 * 
311                 * @return the average color in this box
312                 */
313                float[] getAvgColor() {
314                        double rSum = 0;
315                        double gSum = 0;
316                        double bSum = 0;
317                        int n = 0;
318                        for (int i = lower; i <= upper; i++) {
319                                ColorNode cn = allColors[i];
320                                int cnt = cn.cnt;
321                                rSum = rSum + cnt * cn.red;
322                                gSum = gSum + cnt * cn.grn;
323                                bSum = bSum + cnt * cn.blu;
324                                n = n + cnt;
325                        }
326                        float avgRed = (float) (rSum / n);
327                        float avgGrn = (float) (gSum / n);
328                        float avgBlu = (float) (bSum / n);
329                        return new float[] {avgRed, avgGrn, avgBlu};
330                }
331
332                @Override
333                public String toString() {
334                        String s = this.getClass().getSimpleName();
335                        s = s + " lower=" + lower + " upper=" + upper;
336                        s = s + " count=" + count + " level=" + level;
337                        s = s + " rmin=" + rmin + " rmax=" + rmax;
338                        s = s + " gmin=" + gmin + " gmax=" + gmax;
339                        s = s + " bmin=" + bmin + " bmax=" + bmax;
340                        s = s + " bmin=" + bmin + " bmax=" + bmax;
341                        return s;
342                }
343        }
344                
345        /**
346         * The main purpose of this inner enumeration class is to associate the
347         * color dimensions RED, GRN, BLU with the corresponding comparators
348         * (for sorting along selected color dimensions).
349         */
350        private enum ColorDimension {
351                RED (new Comparator<ColorNode>() {
352                        @Override
353                        public int compare(ColorNode colA, ColorNode colB) {
354                                return Float.compare(colA.red, colB.red);
355                        }}), 
356                GRN (new Comparator<ColorNode>() {
357                        @Override
358                        public int compare(ColorNode colA, ColorNode colB) {
359                                return Float.compare(colA.grn, colB.grn);
360                        }}), 
361                BLU (new Comparator<ColorNode>() {
362                        @Override
363                        public int compare(ColorNode colA, ColorNode colB) {
364                                return Float.compare(colA.blu, colB.blu);
365                        }});
366
367                final Comparator<ColorNode> comparator;
368
369                // constructor:
370                ColorDimension(Comparator<ColorNode> cmp) {
371                        this.comparator = cmp;
372                }
373        }
374        
375        
376        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
377        
378        public static void main(String[] args) {
379//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/alps-01s.png";
380                String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/desaturation-hsv/balls.jpg";
381//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/single-color.png";
382//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/two-colors.png";
383//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/random-colors.png";
384//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/ramp-fire.png";
385                
386                int K = 16; 
387                System.out.println("image = " + path);
388                System.out.println("K = " + K);
389
390                ImagePlus im = IJ.openImage(path);
391                if (im == null) {
392                        System.out.println("could not open: " + path);
393                        return;
394                }
395                
396                ImageProcessor ip = im.getProcessor();
397                ColorProcessor cp = ip.convertToColorProcessor();
398                
399                MedianCutQuantizer quantizer = new MedianCutQuantizer(cp, K);
400                quantizer.listColorMap();
401                
402                System.out.println("quantizing image");
403                ByteProcessor qi = quantizer.quantize(cp);
404                System.out.println("showing image");
405                (new ImagePlus("quantizez", qi)).show();
406                
407        }
408        
409}
